00033 //
00034 // Global header file which contains information of the simulation kernel
00035 // NOTE: It does not provide information about derived classes

00037 
00038 //
00039 // DATA_OBJECT_TRACE: enables data object tracing
00040 //
00041 
00042 // #define DATA_OBJECT_TRACE (1)
00043 
00044 
00045 //
00046 // If EVENT_DEBUG is defined, then the event manager checks that
00047 //         a) no zero delta times are used when calling alarme() / alarml().
00048 //     There are two exceptions:
00049 //    - alarme/l( ..., 0) is legal if currently no Sim->Run is in progress
00050 //      (e.g. during init() and command())
00051 //    - calling alarml( ..., 0) during the early phase (registration for the
00052 //      late phase of the same slot) is allowed
00053 //         b) an event structure is not used twice by alarme(), alarml(), eache(), or eachl()
00054 // 
00055 //  Turning the EVENT_DEBUG on slows the simulator down by approx. 10 per cent.
00056 // 
00057 
00058 // #define EVENT_DEBUG 1
00059 
00060 //
00061 // If RECEIVE_DEBUG is turned on, then all calls of rec() methods are checked
00062 // against two rules:
00063 //  a) sending is only allowed during the early phase of a time step
00064 //  b) only one data object may be transmitted per time step and input
00065 //
00066 // All violations cause an error message. This slows the simulator down by approx. 50 per cent.
00067 //
00068 // Usage of RECEIVE_DEBUG requires that all rec() methods are declared (in the class definition)
00069 // and defined (code of the method body) using the macro name REC instead of the real name rec.
00070 // Otherwise, syntax errors are generated during compilation.
00071 // Calls of rec() methods, however, must *not* be changed. Otherwise, syntax errors are generated
00072 // during compilation.
00073 //
00074 
00075 //#define RECEIVE_DEBUG 1
00076 
00077 #ifdef DATA_OBJECT_TRACE
00078 #define rec(x,y) recTrac((x), (y), this)
00079 #define REC(x,y) recTracOri(x,y,void *(*)())
00080 // The third parameter (void *(*)()) generates a syntax error if
00081 // REC is used when calling a rec() method. A type name as argument is only
00082 // allowed for method declaration and method definition (unused argument).
00083 #else // DATA_OBJECT_TRACE
00084 
00085 #ifdef RECEIVE_DEBUG
00086 #define rec(x,y) recDbg((x),(y),this)
00087 #define REC(x,y) recDbgOri(x,y,void *(*)())
00088 // The third parameter (void *(*)()) generates a syntax error if
00089 // REC is used when calling a rec() method. A type name as argument is only
00090 // allowed for method declaration and method definition (unused argument).
00091 #else // RECEIVE_DEBUG
00092 #define REC(x,y) rec(x,y)
00093 #endif // RECEIVE_DEBUG
00094 
00095 #endif // DATA_OBJECT_TRACE
00096

00099 #endif

00138 //
00139 // Macros enabling the use of a lua logger from C
00140 // - Use only in non realtime parts of code - large overhead !!!
00141 //
00142 extern void write_log(const char *, const char *, ...);
00143 #define fatal(fmt, ...) write_log("fatal", fmt, ## __VA_ARGS__);
00144 #define error(fmt, ...) write_log("error", fmt, ## __VA_ARGS__);
00145 #define warn(fmt, ...) write_log("warn", fmt, ## __VA_ARGS__);
00146 #define info(fmt, ...) write_log("info", fmt, ## __VA_ARGS__);
00147 #define debug(fmt, ...) write_log("debug", fmt, ## __VA_ARGS__);

00224 /**************************************************************************/
00225 // definition of common data classes
00226 //
00227 #define BASECLASS(cl) typedef cl _baseclass_
00228 #define CLASS_KEY(key) enum {_cl_key_ = key}
00229 #define NEW_DELETE(gran)\
00230  static data *pool;\
00231  inline void *operator new(size_t siz)\
00232   { extern void *alloc_pool(size_t, int, dat_typ);\
00233    data *pd;\
00234    if ((pd = pool) == NULL)\
00235     pd = pool = (data *) alloc_pool(siz, gran, (dat_typ) _cl_key_);\
00236    pool = pool->next;\
00237    return pd;\
00238   }\
00239  inline void operator delete(void *p)\
00240   {\
00241    ((data *)p)->next = pool;\
00242    pool = (data *)p;\
00243   }
00244 #define CLONE(aClass)\
00245  virtual data *clone()\
00246  { data *pd;\
00247   pd = new aClass( *this);\
00248   if (embedded)\
00249    pd->embedded = embedded->clone();\
00250   return pd;\
00251  }
00252 #define DATA_CLASS(cl, name)\
00253  { extern void add_class(char *, dat_typ, dat_typ);\
00254    add_class((char*)name, (dat_typ) cl::_cl_key_, (dat_typ) cl::_baseclass_::_cl_key_); \
00255  }
00256 
00257 class root;
00258 #include "data.h"

00261 #undef CLONE
00262 #undef NEW_DELETE
00263 #undef CLASS_KEY
00264 #undef BASECLASS

00282 //tolua_begin
00283 class root {
00284 public:
00285   root(void);  // init object name
00286   virtual ~root(void);
00287   //tolua_end
00288   virtual void init(void);  // read statement for object definition
00289   virtual void addpars(void);  // evaluation of parameters by derived classes
00290   virtual int command(char *, tok_typ *); // perform a command
00291   virtual void connect(void);  // connect to the next node
00292   virtual int handle(char *, root *); // return the key number of the given input name
00293   //tolua_begin
00294   virtual rec_typ REC(data *, int); // Receive data. REC is a macro normally expanding to rec.
00295 
00296   // Activation by the kernel:
00297   virtual void early(event *);  // first slot phase
00298   virtual void late(event *);  // second phase
00299   virtual void restim(void);  // information about reset of SimTime
00300   //tolua_end
00301   virtual char *special(specmsg *, char *);
00302   // all special things ...
00303   // return != NULL: error description
00304 
00305   virtual int export(exp_typ *); // export adresses of variables:
00306   // e.g. for graphical display
00307   //tolua_begin
00308   //  char *name;   // object name
00309   root *next;
00310   char *name;
00311   tim_typ time;
00312   //tolua_end
00313 #ifdef DATA_OBJECT_TRACE
00314 
00315   rec_typ recTrac(data *, int, root *);
00316 #endif // DATA_OBJECT_TRACE
00317 
00318 #ifdef RECEIVE_DEBUG
00319 
00320   struct recDbgObj {
00321     int key;
00322     tim_typ time;
00323     recDbgObj *next;
00324   };
00325   recDbgObj *recDbgList;
00326   rec_typ recDbg(data *, int, root *);
00327 #endif // RECEIVE_DEBUG
00328 
00329 #ifdef USELUA
00330   //tolua_begin
00331   virtual int act(void) {
00332     return 0;
00333   }
00334   //tolua_end
00335 #endif
00336 }
00337 ; // end definition class root

00346 /*
00347 * Data structure for the event manager
00348 */
00349 //tolua_begin
00350 #define MAGICEVT    (0x22091991)
00351 #define MAGICEVTCHK (0xccf6e66e)
00352 
00353 class event {
00354 public:
00355   // forbid uninitialized events
00356   inline event(root *o, int k) {
00357     obj = o;
00358     key = k;
00359 #ifdef EVENT_DEBUG
00360     used = FALSE;
00361 #endif
00362 
00363   }
00364   ~event() {}
00365   //tolua_end
00366   inline void *operator new(size_t siz) {
00367     event *p;
00368     CHECK(p = (event *)malloc(siz));
00369     p->dyn = MAGICEVT;
00370     p->dynchk = MAGICEVTCHK;
00371     p->next = NULL;
00372     return (void *) p;
00373   }
00374   inline void operator delete(void *p, size_t siz) {
00375     free(p);
00376   }
00377   //tolua_begin
00378   root *obj;  // the object to activate
00379   tim_typ time;  // the time of activation
00380   int key;  // tell different timers from each other
00381   event *next;  // for the event lists
00382   int stat;
00383   unsigned int dyn;
00384   unsigned int dynchk;
00385   //tolua_end
00386 #ifdef EVENT_DEBUG
00387 
00388   int used;  // TRUE: event is currently used by the scheduler
00389 #endif
00390 }
00391 ; //tolua_export

00394 /*
00395 * Data structures for parser and scanner
00396 */
00397 typedef struct _m_t_ mac_typ;
00398 struct _t_t_ {
00399   int tok;   // token type
00400   char *nam;   // name
00401   struct _t_t_ *next;
00402   struct _t_t_ *ref;  // pointer to the genuine memory place, needed to make assignments
00403   // to variables
00404   unsigned long blockID; // block ID where symbol has been declared
00405   union {
00406     int i;  // interger value
00407     double d;  // double
00408     char *s;  // string
00409     mac_typ *m;  // pointer to macro data
00410     root *o;  // pointer to an object
00411     root *(*creat)(void);// pointer to the interface routine of a class constructor
00412   } val;
00413 };
00414 
00415 /*
00416 * Structure to manage macros
00417 */
00418 
00419 struct _m_t_ {
00420   tok_typ *args;  // argument names
00421   int argc;  // # of arguments
00422   tok_typ lab;  // starting point of the macro body
00423 };

00500 /**************************************************************************/
00501 /*
00502 * Token values:
00503 * do not declare values >= 0 - the routine skip() displays the desired token
00504 * as character if the token value > 0
00505 */
00506 /* already declared identifiers and composed tokens like '->' */
00507 #define IVAR (-1)  /* Variable, currently contains int */
00508 #define DVAR (-2)  /* Variable, currently contains double */
00509 #define SVAR (-3)  /* Variable, currently contains string */
00510 #define IVAL (-4)  /* int value */
00511 #define DVAL (-5)  /* double value */
00512 #define SVAL (-6)  /* String */
00513 #define MAC_ID (-7)  /* Macro identifier */
00514 #define OBJ (-8)  /* object identifier */
00515 #define CLASS (-9)  /* class id */
00516 #define END (-10)  /* end ofd input */
00517 #define UID (-11)  /* (yet) unknown identifier */
00518 #define EQ (-12)  /* == */
00519 #define NE (-13)  /* != */
00520 #define LE (-14)  /* <= */
00521 #define GE (-15)  /* >= */
00522 #define PTR (-16)  /* -> */
00523 #define AND (-17)  /* && */
00524 #define OR (-18)  /* || */
00525 #define NILVAR (-19)  /* noninitialised variable,
00526 
00527 macro with unassigned return value, or
00528                              command without return value
00529                                                     (neither of them can't be used in expressions)
00530                                                      */
00531                                                      /* key words */
00532 #define VAR (-100)
00533 #define PRINT (-101)
00534 #define IF (-102)
00535 #define ELSE (-103)
00536 #define FOR (-104)
00537 #define TO (-105)
00538 #define MACRO (-106)
00539 #define FOREACH (-107)
00540 #define WHILE (-108)
00541 #define DEREF (-109)
00542 #define STRING (-110)
00543 #define INT (-111)
00544 #define DOUBLE (-112)
00545 #define SYSTEM (-113)
00546 #define ENV (-114)
00547 #define EXIT (-115)
00548 #define POW (-116)
00549 #define EXP (-117)
00550 #define LOG (-118)
00551 #define SQRT (-119)
00552 #define SWITCH (-120)
00553 #define CASE (-121)
00554 #define DEFAULT (-122)
00555 #define RAND (-123)
00556 #define REF (-124)
00557 #define LIT (-125)
00558 #define GLOBAL (-126)

00565 #define TXT_MAX (70000)  // max length of input text (with includes)
00566                                                      //tolua_begin
00567 #define TIME_LEN (100000)  // basic length for running the simulator
00568 
00569 #define NILVCI (-1)  // common constant for an unknown VCI
00570 
00571                                                      // first and second slot phases
00572 #define EARLY (1)
00573 #define LATE (2)

00579                                                      /**************************************************************************/
00580                                                      // Macro to easily define the interface routine of a class constructor
00581 #define CONSTRUCTOR(func, cl) root *func(void)\
00582 { root *r;\
00583 CHECK(r = new cl);\
00584 return r;\
00585 }
00586 
00587                                                      /**************************************************************************/
00588                                                      // Registration for events: inline
00589                                                      // registration for the first slot phase
00590 #ifdef EVENT_DEBUG
00591                                                      enum evt_dbg_enum
00592                                                      { Alarme,
00593                                                      Alarml,
00594                                                      Eache,
00595                                                      Eachl
00596                                                      };
00597                                                      extern void check_evt(event *, tim_typ, enum evt_dbg_enum);
00598 #endif
00599                                                      //tolua_begin
00600                                                      inline void alarme(
00601                                                      event *evt,
00602                                                      tim_typ delta)
00603                                                      {
00604                                                      event **e;
00605                                                      extern event *eventse[];
00606 
00607 #ifdef EVENT_DEBUG
00608                                                      check_evt(evt, delta, Alarme);
00609 #endif
00610 
00611                                                      e = eventse + ((evt->time = SimTime + delta) % TIME_LEN);
00612                                                      evt->next = *e;
00613                                                      *e = evt;
00614                                                      }
00615 
00616                                                      // registration for the second slot phase
00617                                                      inline void alarml(
00618                                                      event *evt,
00619                                                      tim_typ delta)
00620                                                      {
00621                                                      event **e;
00622                                                      extern event *eventsl[];
00623 
00624 #ifdef EVENT_DEBUG
00625                                                      check_evt(evt, delta, Alarml);
00626 #endif
00627 
00628                                                      e = eventsl + ((evt->time = SimTime + delta) % TIME_LEN);
00629                                                      evt->next = *e;
00630                                                      *e = evt;
00631                                                      }
00632                                                      //tolua_end
00633 
00634                                                      // For usage in source code files for user defined object classes.
00635                                                      // Make config copies the lines to src/kernel/class.c, where this macro is overriden.
00636 #define USERCLASS(xxx,yyy) /* void */
